Comments_List: Basic understanding of the Indonesian language (bahasa Indonesia) and culture (food, music).
A basic understanding and ability to speak indonesian
I learned to speak Indonesian and feel confident about my level one knowledge.
Good understanding of L1 Indonesian, writing and speaking.
By taking this course, I developed skills to speak, read, and write a new language.
I learned how to speak, read and write Indonesian. the class also taught me a lot of info on Indonesian culture.
This course provided an accessible introduction to the Indonesian language and culture.
everything I know in Indonesian i learned from this course
I have developed a better understanding of the culture and language.
A basic knowledge of the Indonesian language

Strengths: Pak Indriyo is great. Give the man tenure. His first and foremost concern is teaching and making sure we learn -- not all professors are like that.

Weaknesses: A little disorganized. Emails sent out at absurd times (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 a.m. emails are the norm. Be prepared for an assignment due in class to be mailed out at 4 a.m. the day of at least once).
Very funny and fun.
Strengths are showing up everyday, weaknesses are speaking the language.

Strengths: Very fun and interactive class which makes learning a language easier. 
Weakness: It is an L1 class so I believe the professors should have spoken a little more English to avoid confusion on assignments.

Strengths - Indonesian was a fun course. I was always excited to come to class. the Professor was really cool. Weaknesses - it took ages to get our tests and homework back. Sometimes months and i really found this was quite annoying. Also I kind of wish we had a real book for class and not just like a bunch of worksheets

The learning in class was engaging and helped me quickly develop an understanding of basic structures and vocabulary. It might have been helpful to get more feedback on in-class assignments and activities.
I thought it was a great learning experience and very interactive.

Strengths - fun & engaging

Weaknesses - not very well organised

I would. Firstly, Indonesian is actually an easy language to pick up and be relatively competent in speaking/writing/reading. Secondly, Pak Indriyo is a caring, hilarious teacher and his anecdotes are 10/10. Third, you can put a ton of effort into this course when you have the time/are able but during those hell weeks for other classes you can basically do nothing besides show up -- it's a very take-your-own-path type course. 

Also, the TA we had (Yudhis!) here on the Fulrbright is the GOAT. Absolute best TA at Yale, they should bring him on to faculty.
Ya. Ada baik sekali.
Yes I highly recommend.
Yes, this course is very fun and interesting. Not only do you learn the Indonesian language, you also learn about the culture of Indonesia.
yeah 100%! Indonesian was one of the coolest classes I've taken at yale. You will not regret taking it. the professor is good.
Yes, Pak Indriyo and the TF's all took time to help the class become more comfortable with the language.
Yes, if you are interested in the subject!
Yes
